sentences: Doug Stone (born Douglas Jackson Brooks; June 19, 1956) is an American country music singer and actor.
He debuted in 1990 with the single "I'd Be Better Off (In a Pine Box)", the first release from his 1990 self-titled debut album for Epic Records.
Both this album and its successor, 1991's I Thought
Two more albums for Epic, 1992's From the Heart and 1994's More Love, are each certified gold.
Two more albums for Epic, 1992's From the Heart and 1994's More Love, are each certified gold.
After suffering a heart attack and stroke in the late 1990s, he exited the label and did not release another album until Make Up in Love in 1999 on Atlantic Records.
The Long Way was released in 2002 on the Audium label (now part of E1 Music), followed by two albums on the independent Lofton Creek Records.
Stone has charted twenty-six singles on Hot Country Songs, with his greatest chart success coming between 1990 and 1995.
Stone was born as Douglas Jackson Brooks on June 19, 1956, in Marietta, Georgia.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: By 1982, Stone was suffering from depression brought on by his musical career, when a friend introduced him to Carie Cohen, who would later become his second wife.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Through Montgomery's assistance, Stone signed with Epic in 1989, thus becoming the only artist that Montgomery ever signed without seeing perform live.

sentences: Stone's self-titled debut album was released in 1990 with Johnson as producer.

sentences: Contributing songwriters included David Lee Murphy, Larry Boone, Randy Boudreaux, A.L. "Doodle" Owens, and Keith Palmer, who would later chart two singles for Epic in 1991.

sentences: Stone received three music award nominations in 1991: the Horizon Award (now New Artist Award) from the Country Music Association, Star of Tomorrow from Music City News, and Top New Male Vocalist from the Academy of Country Music.

sentences: Also in 1995, parent company Sony Music Entertainment chose to move Stone from the Nashville division of Epic Records to that of Columbia Records.

sentences: In December 1999, Stone was aboard an airplane which skidded off a snowy runway at O'Hare Airport in Chicago; there were no injuries.

sentences: Stone began piloting ultra-light airplanes as a hobby in 1999 and 2000.
section: == Musical career == | === 2000-present: The Long Way, In a Different Light, and My Turn ===

sentences: In March 2000, he suffered a broken left ankle, cracked rib, concussion, and bruised kidney after crashing his plane in Robertson County, Tennessee, and was briefly hospitalized before he resumed touring.

sentences: Stone married his second wife, Carie Cohen, in 1982.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: The couple separated in July 1994, and Cohen filed for divorce two months later, accusing Stone of excessive drinking and infidelity.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He married Beth Snyder in December 1996 after being engaged to her for a year.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: As of 2005, he had one daughter, Baili, with Beth, and four children from his previous marriages: daughter Michelle and son Daniel from his first marriage, son Chanse and daughter Kala from his marriage to Cohen,  Stone split from Snyder in late 2006 and returned to his Georgia home.
